title: Will the cost of 5G connection be very high compared to 4G? - Quora

response.answer_text: 5G has more advanced features than any other generation in mobile communications. It assures improved bandwidth, zero latency, great speed, etc. But with great speed comes great cost. According to Cisco with advances in wireless speeds, consumers’ data usage has soared. But according to the wireless analysts, it is expected that cell phone costs will come down to make 5G affordable. 5G has the following features which make it more efficient – It will be much faster than existing cellular networksIt will have a quick response as compared to 4GImproved bandwidthEnhanced download and upload speedsAll the above-mentioned features of 5G are some of the advantages of 5G over 4G. The 5G technology will be available in India by 2021, also Reliance Jio is working towards building and improving 5G infrastructure. Soon it will launch 5G devices and services to the consumers at affordable prices. Along with 5G technology, it will also offer the users new augmented and virtual reality experiences on devices.

Cost of 4G connections. Hmm that is a very vague term. Do you remember that all the telecom companies had created a consortium to charge prices as high as Rs. 250 per GB before Jio stepped in? Now the same companies selling plans offering up to 45GB a month for as little as Rs. 150. Needless to say, this primary facie looks like there was a huge profit margin behind expensive data (I am guessing in thousands of %) The cost of data is never too high except the initial stages wherein the cost of infrastructure needs to be recovered, it is the huge margin that the companies charged over the cost price that makes the end product expensive. So to answer your question, though the prices of 5G might be a bit higher in the initial stages, it should soon drop into a reasonable range soon as economies of scale kick in.
